questions.question_text:
An administrator has created a change set to include a validation rule and three custom fields in their personal sandbox. When clicking the button to upload to production, no target organizations are available.

Which two options should the administrator check? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Deployment connection needs to be authorized.
choices.D: The change set has missing dependencies.
choices.A: The change set is in an open status.

discussion.content:
B. Deployment connection needs to be authorized and C. Deployment connection is incomplete are the two options that the administrator should check.

If no target organizations are available when trying to upload a change set to production, it is likely that the deployment connection is not fully set up or authorized. The administrator should check that the deployment connection is authorized and complete.

The change set being in an open status and having missing dependencies are not likely to be the issue in this scenario, as the change set was already created in the sandbox and is ready to be deployed.

comments.content: Using Approval Process also, email notification can be sent.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Approval process could send the notification and reassign owner, this would be a more efficient and streamlined approach than using a separate workflow rule.

Selected Answer: B
I believe B is correct because while the approval process can send a notification out, the notification would go to the approver, who is not the partner channel manager. Thus workflow rules are needed to notify the external channel manager.

A. Assignment rules and approval processes are the automation tools that are needed to meet minimally these requirements.

Assignment rules can be used to assign leads to the correct sales team based on criteria such as region or other lead fields. The administrator can create an assignment rule that assigns leads from the APAC region to an external partner queue for review.

An approval process can be used to get approval from the Sales Director before the lead is transferred to the external partner. The administrator can create an approval process that sends an email to the Sales Director when a lead is assigned to the external partner queue. The Sales Director can then approve or reject the lead transfer, and the lead will either be assigned to the partner or to a sales team based on the outcome.

Therefore, using these two automation tools, the administrator can ensure that leads are assigned to the correct sales team and transferred to the external partner only after the Sales Director's approval.
I guess workflow rule is used to check approval process status: updating ownership of the record to partner.

The sales VP wants to see the custom Bonus Amount field summed to the Amount level; however, the ability to create a summary field is grayed out.

Which adjustment does the administrator need to make in order to utilize a custom summary field?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C

In order to utilize a custom summary field, the administrator needs to add data grouping to the report.

When the ability to create a summary field is grayed out, it means that the report is not currently being grouped by any field. In order to use a custom summary field, the report needs to be grouped by a field.

Adding data grouping to the report will enable the administrator to group the report by the field that the custom summary field is based on, and then the ability to create a summary field should become available.

questions.question_text:
Sales leaders at Ursa Major Solar would like to be able to calculate forecasts based on megawatts.

How can the administrator create forecast types based on a megawatts measurement?

discussion.content:
The administrator can create a custom number field to measure forecasts in megawatts.

Here are the steps to create a custom forecast type based on a megawatts measurement:

Go to Setup and navigate to the Object Manager for the Opportunity object.
Click on Fields & Relationships and then click New.
Select Number as the data type for the new field.
Enter a label and a name for the new field (e.g. Megawatts Forecast).
Under Field Level Security, ensure that the new field is visible to the appropriate profiles.
Click Next and then Save to create the new field.
Navigate to the Forecasting Settings page in Setup.
Click on Manage Forecast Types and then New Forecast Type.
Enter a name for the new forecast type (e.g. Megawatts Forecast).
Select the Megawatts Forecast field as the Primary Quantity field.
Click Save to create the new forecast type.
Once the new forecast type has been created, sales leaders can then use it to calculate forecasts based on megawatts.
